intro: Pelecyphora aselliformis var. concolor, commonly known as the smooth pelecyphora, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in woodland or streamside habitats. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat destruction, it is considered endangered in many regions.
